messages.content: ComfyUI_tinyterraNodes is a selection of custom nodes for ComfyUI, a GUI that uses stable diffusion models to generate images and videos.
What is the purpose of the Fullscreen Image Viewer feature in ComfyUI_tinyterraNodes?

The Fullscreen Image Viewer feature in ComfyUI_tinyterraNodes allows users to view all images generated by a selected node during the current comfy session in fullscreen mode. It also provides a Slideshow Mode to automatically jump to new images as they are generated.
What is the syntax for using the Advanced XYPlot node in ComfyUI_tinyterraNodes?

The syntax for using the Advanced XYPlot node is: 
<axis number1:label1>
[node_ID:widget_Name='value']
<axis number2:label2>
[node_ID:widget_Name='value2']
[node_ID:widget2_Name='value']
[node_ID2:widget_Name='value']
What is the purpose of the 'Reload Node' option in the ttNinterface feature of ComfyUI_tinyterraNodes?

The 'Reload Node' option in the ttNinterface feature of ComfyUI_tinyterraNodes creates a new instance of a node with the same position, size, color, and title. It attempts to retain set widget values, which is useful for replacing nodes when a node/widget update occurs.
What is the purpose of the 'Save image prefix parsing' feature in ComfyUI_tinyterraNodes?

The 'Save image prefix parsing' feature in ComfyUI_tinyterraNodes allows users to add date/time info to filenames or output folders by using '%date:yyyy-MM-dd-hh-mm-ss%'. It also allows parsing of any upstream setting into filenames or output folders by using '%[widget_name]%' or '%input_name>input_name>widget_name%'.
What is the difference between pipeKSampler v1 and pipeKSampler v2 in ComfyUI_tinyterraNodes?

pipeKSampler v2 in ComfyUI_tinyterraNodes is an updated version of pipeKSampler v1. It includes an embedded Advanced CLIP Text Encode with an additional pipe output. The node layout has also been updated in v2.
What is the purpose of the 'Node Versioning' feature in ComfyUI_tinyterraNodes?

The 'Node Versioning' feature in ComfyUI_tinyterraNodes adds a version property to all tinyterraNodes. This allows the nodes to be highlighted on load if any future changes are made to widgets that would break workflows. However, this feature will only work with workflows created/saved after the v1.0.0 release.
